comments.commentBody: Ukraine was it's own nation for longer than I've been alive and were doing fine until big bully KGB man Putin decided that the power change in Kiev was an excellent opportunity to get more territory.  The often repeated comparison to what happened to the Sudetenland in the late '30s is perfect!

@ Born in the USSR, Bohadan Khmelnicky is not a national hero; in fact many fault him for bringing Kievan Rus under the Muscovite sphere in the Treaty of Perislav.... It is a fact he had committed murderous campaigns against Jews in Russian and Ukrainian lands what would later be known as pogroms: a system of extermination used by Russians after the assassination of Alexander the II.  If Taras Schevncko was an anti-Semite why was he considered a national hero in the Soviet Union?  Equating the trident to the Nazi swastika is offensive; it has no historical fact and the trident has been in existence since Vladimir the Great (988AD). Any commemoration of the Bandera movement was for its efforts to battle against the USSR (a nation which starved 7 million Ukrainians) during WWII; those who worked for the Nazis were a small number as many nations under Nazi occupation had the collaborators.  You also mentioned the head of the Jewish congress condemned the commemoration!  Conversely the head of Rabbi of Ukraine noted his greatest fear in Ukraine is not the rise of anti-Semitism but a Putin land invasion.   The efforts to anchor Ukraine to its past denies Ukraine to grow and seek acceptance in the world community as an Independent nation.  If Germany was absolved of its historical past Ukraine should be afforded the same!

Wendell Murrary. There is no military aggression by the U.S. The Russian have been very active in the Ukraine. This was proven in the Crimea. The Russians have also resumed aerial overflights of NATO ships and installations. There are no U.S. troops on Ukrainian soil. You talk of" the ceaseless false propaganda of the USA press". This fact may have escaped your attention; Our press is not a monolith. What FOX reports, MSNBC may not. What the New York Times reports, doesn't coincide with the Washington Times. Now, if you want a muzzled press that spreads propaganda, try RT. Statements such as these are either willful ignorance of  facts or pro-Putin propaganda in themselves.

If Stalin had treated the Ukrainians like people the Waffen SS Galicean Division would have never been formed. Part of the reason that Ukrainians joined this Nazi creation was they wanted to fight against the Russians, under whose hand they had so grievously suffered in the 1930's (see Robert Conquest's "The Great Hunger").

Here are the hard facts. Ukraine's national hero whose statue adorn Kiev, is Khmelnicky whose troops murdered hundreds of thousands of Jews. Their national poet is Shevchenko who call for murder of Jews and Poles. Ukraine's national symbol is a trident, the symbol of the Bandera movement - a pro-nazi movement during WW2 whose atrocities against civilian Jewish population can only be compared to the Mongol invasions.

Just last week the city of Lvov commemorated the SS "Galichina" division of the Bandera movement. No politician in Ukraine condermned them. The only person who did that was the Head of the Ukrainian Jewish Congress, V. Rabinovich. It has never been reported in the Western media.

The influential Ukrainian Right Sector openly professes nazi ideology.

It is frightening how close minded the western media are. It reminds of the worst times of the Soviet Union.

And, no, I'm not pro-Russia, I was born there and I left it. I'm against fascist Ukraine

the Sinn Fein are more  worried more about the election than the horrendous crime  committed against a family of a widow and her 10 children the likes could only have been committed by the vilest of the vilest. then after the murder threatening the small children with a death threat that is still keeping them in FEAR today. are you prepared to deny the family the rights to justice for the sake of a few votes? if so you as bad as the ones who killed the mother of 10 chidren who needed her

"The balance of public interest", defined during 800 years of brutal British occupation of the island of Ireland, has consistently been applied by British authorities, and their minions, solely in British interests."

Whenever someone prefaces their argument with words such as 800 years of occupation or 200 years of oppression, they've stated clearly that their demands for justice could never be satisfied.
It is fortunate indeed that the millions who died as a consequence of the two world wars started by Germany don't make similar demands. Descendants of black slaves and Native Indians could make similar claims as could Mexico for the loss of territory.
Let's remember that this discussion started as an investigation of murders that occurred over a period of decades and confine it to facts pertaining to that time.
The heated rhetoric from this group with broader ambitions for compensation, burdened by a selectively distorted historical narrative serves only to hinder the prospects for reconciliation.

As the Adams interrogation continues, with his attorney present, the British Northern Ireland Secretary, Theresa Villiers, announced that British Prime Minister Cameron understood the "sensitivity and the seriousness" of the situation. That statement serves to confirm that the concern which Mr Cameron exhibits confirms that this is indeed a British Government issue. Mr Cameron calls the shots, not the Northern Ireland police.

Respondents opinions expressed are welcome and some are edifying. The references to the South African and other peace experiences are pertinent. The peace pact in NI required all sides to rein in their adherents and rely that all would adhere to the terms agreed to; the British, being consistent with their long history of dealing with Ireland and the Irish have broken trust.

Predicting the outcome is premature; suffice to say that the Good Friday Agreement has suffered a serious setback and one that could have easily been avoided. Those who opposed the agreement have been handed the gift of "I told you so", and may be emboldened to return to terrorism. Should that happen, Mr Cameron, will indeed have blood on his hands.

As I stated earlier the British are squarely in the dock of public opinion and they do hold the key to maintaining and promoting continued peace and justice. Arresting a sitting Member of Parliament, leader of a major political party, would be expected in a third world country, not in a part of The United Kingdom.

"The balance of public interest", defined during 800 years of brutal British occupation of the island of Ireland, has consistently been applied by British authorities, and their minions, solely in British interests. The fact that Gerry Adams presented himself voluntarily to the N. I. police to discuss their concerns regarding the appalling crime in question, the murder of Mrs McConville, a widow, the mother of ten children, and his retention in custody; no matter whether he is released or not, charged or freed, contrasts vividly with the refusal of that same British government to apply the same standards of concern for their law as it relates to their refusal to investigate or prosecute wanton murders of marching civilians committed by British Paratroopers in Derry, or the many selective assassinations by the British of Irishmen and women during the troubles.

Adams, is now leader of Sinn Fein, the only island wide political party and a member of Dail Eareann, the Irish Parliament, which sits in Dublin. Without the active concern, commitment and diligence of Gerry Adams, the peace pact arrived at in Northern Ireland would never have happened. Not for a moment do I excuse IRA atrocities during the trouble; the fact is without Adams and his colleagues the blood letting would have continued, despite the good offices of Senator Mitchell, and US support to promote and maintain peace.

The British are in the dock and hold the key to continued peace and justice. History will judge.

I'm a union shop steward and your response that Carl had no option but to quit is just wrong. A man with a child doesn't quit his job unless he has another one set up and waiting, its just irresponsible. And from the sound of it, chances are that if you give him a union job he'll be one of those members who will use his union protection to do as little as he can get by with. What is lacking in many working men is a respect for labor and the dignity that a job well done can provide and that erodes their sense of self-respect, their vigor and their sense of purpose. Where does this lack of respect come from? From a culture that derides work and denigrates people who physically labor for a living by labeling them with derogatory names, think of what we called the Chinese who built our railroads, the Blacks who picked our cotton, the Mexicans who come to do the work we won't and the union members who are willing to fight for a fair slice of the pie as our own Mayor Bloomberg did when he labeled our city union members as thugs.

When someone is an at will employee, he has no remedy, no protection from an abusive employer except to quit. That is a system Douthat would be the last to change.

Employers with this power ARE abusive, extremely so. It is infamous in some of our larger employers just how badly they treat employees, such as WalMart, but many others.

With the decline of unions, more of us are vulnerable to the absolute power of abuse of employers, and they know it, and they abuse it.

So of course he quit. It is the only option. He clearly did not dislike co-workers, since he maintains social contacts with them.

Douthat blames him for that.

How about better working conditions, protected by unions? Then Carl and others could keep their jobs, and likely have more to contribute to support their kids too.

Douthat just wants to wash his hands of both the father and the children, for the greed of the employer and the wealthy who don't pay their fair share of taxes on the income and wealth they have Bogarted.

Judyw - Can you please explain how can a Ukrainian land be taken over be the Ukrainian government?  Whether Ukraine was a part of the former Soviet Union is hardly relevant, since the Soviet leaders created Ukrainian SSR back in 1920s, and later on they even made sure that she is represented in the UN.
It would seem that quite a few Ukrainians don't agree with you. Is it your argument that all countries that were part of an empire are not real countries.

Why? Is this the Russian version to sneak in some Nazi references?

Sure seems like it is.

The last thing we have to worry about is Germany. The real worry is about Russia. And what will become of her people after Putin has decimated their country.

What present government? The democratically elected president, Yanukovich, fled the country. The Rada then made decisions under the Ukrainian constitution to create an interim government until elections could be held.

AN 94s have been seen in the Ukraine and filmed in news reports and the only countries in the world that uses that weapon is Russia. I challenge to give one proven example of a western military force invading Ukraine. It is not the west that has invaded another country and taken its territory.
Obama is wide awake.  He's just not what we thought he was.  He's basically a right-wing jerk.  Still, I don't regret voting for him, given the alternatives.

Wake up and smell the coffee. All nations are spying on each other and on their own citizens.. All nations with advanced technology are using advanced technology to spy on each other and on their own citizens.

God bless you Angela Merkel: thank you for saying out loud what many of us, even enthusiastic voters for Obama in 2008 (and more or less resigned voters in 2012), have been thinking. President Obama, please wake up!!

Rima,

So how much money did the government give Bell, or the Wright Brothers? How much did they give Henry Ford or Philo Farnsworth?

The point is most of the really inovative things were done by Americans as individuals, both those born here and those who came here. They didn't apply for a government grant and wait. They sold the family car ( Carl's Jr.), they saved, or they borrowed from a variety of private sources. Our system of government and our Constution made it possible. Private Citizens and Corporations funded it.

Today the decendents of those leaders are raising money for the next generation of amazing advances that again will change the way we live, not from the government but from private investors on the World Wide Web.

As for the government going to the moon, it was done as a demonstration of American technology with no thought of actually staying there or going further. Today, again Private American Industry is developing the means to return to the Moon and stay at pennies on the dollar. Yes the Feds are paying some of these companies to provide services that they (NASA) can't provide themselves which is far better than paying the Russians to supply the same services!

All of these things were done by American people not as part of a public group but as small private groups or as individuals. No politicians of any political party need apply! No Al Gore didn't invent the internet either!

The liberal mind is an interesting thing that should be studied far and wide by psychiatrists. What  is amusing is that many liberals actually believe increasing taxes will help the economy. If you take more cash out of the private sector, while it might temporarily give a few people jobs filling potholes, over the long term its going to hurt small business, destroy new job creation, and give us more stellar Obama style economics like 0.1% GDP growth.

U.S corporate sector profit margins are at their highest level in 65 years. At the same time wages have stagnated and there is an unacceptably high level of unemployment. Any rational solution must include increased tax revenues necessary to support more jobs at home - namely infrastructure repair and improvement and investment in education and scientific research. Unless there is some guarantee of increased government revenue, lowering or eliminating corporate taxes at this time is a very bad idea.
Republican spin doctors to candidates: Unemployment hit 6.3%. Talk about capital punishment.
So you are saying the state should actively torture criminals sentenced to death as a matter of policy?
If it is not the second amendment, no conservative will even notice.

If this botched execution truly did violate the constitutional prohibition against cruel and unusual punishment, who will bring charges against the state's representatives, and where shall they be tried in a court of law?  I personally would like to see some serious legal action on this case, and others like it.  Only when actions result in consequences will people take more notice of the law.

So you are saying that we should repeat the behaviors we claim to abhor? That we should punish criminals with the same callous disregard for life that they portray? How do we then separate our actions from theirs?

I think we can rise above actions of criminals and find better ways to react.
So sorry that you must make the choice between paying for your kids' futures and your own.

Ozy Media "has received financing from Laurene Powell Jobs, widow of Steve Jobs". The name "Ozy" "was inspired by Shelley’s poem “Ozymandias”".

Start-Up Ozy Media Adds Axel Springer as a Backer
By SYDNEY EMBER
MARCH 31, 2014
http://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/31/business/media/start-up-ozy-media-adds...

OK, but most people are not the subject of a 630 page biography:

Making the iBio for Apple’s Genius
By JANET MASLIN
Published: October 21, 2011
http://www.nytimes.com/2011/10/22/books/steve-jobs-by-walter-isaacson-re...
But did Mr. Jobs pay the fine? (AFAICT, Mr. Isaacson doesn't say ...)

Oh, c'mon.  The cries to prosecute the banksters and mortgage frauds, the Wall Street conmen, and other malefactors of great wealth have resounded even as our common fortunes in this nation sink away.  Not that it seems to matter to the prosecution of crimes at that level, anyway.  But pretending that people are picking on Jobs because he is deceased is disingenuous.  It's the revelations now forthcoming of these crimes that are the cause of this article and these comments.

In professional sports, the "poaching" described here is called "tampering," and no one goes to jail for enforcing the anti-tampering rule when it's violated. Nor does any company get punished for insisting on non-competes, which restrict who you can and can't work for and when. Seems we want to be very selective in deciding when the same activity is acceptable or evil, depending on who does it. And whether or not that person is even alive to defend himself. Stay classy, people.

Antitrust violations? With dear Mr Jobs, that was the least of it. How about having his little gizmos assembled in China, thereby helping destroy jobs (And to think the pundits once proclaimed the 'death of irony') in this country in the very long term? Then again, he might have inadvertantly managed do do an astounding job of miniaturising Trojan horses. As far as being 'deeply revered in Silicon Valley', you can ask many of those who actually worked for this chap and you'll get a bit of a different view, which is sort of like saying it gets a bit warm in Saudi Arabia's drier spots. When all is said and done, the verdict may well be that dealing the works of Jobs may truly require the patience of Job.
Cheap shot, Tom.  The burdens of German history have taught present-day Germans a thing or two about freedom, human rights, the all-powerful state.

We're middle class and we afforded it.  You don't have to go to the most expensive school, you don't have to get a new car when one is paid for, you can buy a house within your means and pay off the mortgage early.  No one absolutely needs a smart phone.  Make compromises.
Stand your ground Angela. Hold Obama's feet to the fire this spying has to stop.
